Jeune fille à sa fenêtre, 1869.

Oil on canvas, 36.8 × 45.4 cm. Private collection

The painting represents the artist's sister, Edma.

From 1877, critics are less and less divided. We praise the delicacy of its colors, its vaporous touch and its spontaneity. In The Artist , George Rivière even goes so far as to affirm that his style surpasses that of his former master : “His eye is sensitive, even more sensitive than that of M. Manet who, often driven by power (…) neglects the tones”.
